(1) All the powers and duties of the Secretary for Scotland shall be transferred to one of His Majesty's principal Secretaries of State. 10(2) So much of section two of the Secretary for Scotland Act, 1885, as relates to the appointment of a Secretary for Scotland and the payment of a salary to him shall cease to have effect, and section three and the first paragraph of section four of the said Act are hereby repealed. 15(3) In the construction and for the purposes of any Act of Parliament, judgment, decree, order, award, warrant, deed, contract, regulation, byelaw, or other document (a) if passed or made after the passing of this. (1) Anything in relation to the powers or duties transferred by this Act which was commenced by or under the 30 authority of the Secretary for Scotland before the passing of this Act may be carried on and completed by or under the authority of the Secretary of State.(2) Any legal proceeding pending at the time of the passing of this Act to which the Secretary for Scotland is a 35 party, and which has reference to the powers and duties trans-ferred by this Act, shall not abate by reason of such transfer.(3) Notwithstanding anything in any Act, if the person who at the time of the passing of this Act holds the office of Secretary for Scotland is within one month thereafter appointed to be one 40Transitory provisions. of His Majesty's principal Secretaries of State, he shall not by A.D. 1919. reason of his acceptance of that office vacate his seat in the House of Commons. .(4) All permanent secretaries, inspectors, clerks, or other 5 officers employed' under the Secretary for Scotland at the time of the passing of this Act shall hold their offices and places under the Secretary of State, and shall do so upon the same terms and conditions, and shall have the same powers, privileges, and immunities with respect to the performance of their duties 10 as if this Act had not passed.5.
